scenarios.title: Phishing Email Alert
scenarios.description: You receive an email that appears to come from a trusted company but contains suspicious links and unexpected requests for personal or work-related information.
tasks: Review the email content for potential red flags (e.g., urgent language, spelling mistakes, or mismatched sender address).
Decide whether to interact with any links or attachments.
Follow the internal procedure for reporting suspicious emails.
scenarios.solution: Identify the suspicious elements in the email, do not click on any links or attachments, and immediately report the email to IT/security as per the established process. This prevents potential breaches and protects sensitive company data by ensuring prompt response and investigation.
learning_objectives: Recognize common signs of phishing.
Understand the proper process for reporting suspicious emails.

scenarios.title: Secure Password Challenge
scenarios.description: Your company has announced a mandatory password update. The system requires you to create a strong password that meets the new security guidelines.
tasks: Review the current password’s strength.
Follow the guidelines for creating a strong password.
Decide on a new password that avoids common words and predictable patterns.
scenarios.solution: Evaluate your current password, then create a new one using a mix of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters, ensuring it does not contain easily guessable sequences. This approach strengthens account security and minimizes the risk of unauthorized access.
learning_objectives: Learn what makes a password strong and secure.
Understand the importance of regular password updates.

scenarios.title: Infected Device Response
scenarios.description: Your computer starts acting unusually—slow performance, unexpected pop-ups, and odd file behavior—which might indicate a malware infection or early ransomware attack.
tasks: Assess the symptoms on your device.
Decide on the immediate action to take.
Follow the company’s incident reporting procedure.
scenarios.solution: Immediately disconnect the device from the network, avoid interacting with suspicious files, and report the incident to IT/security following the established protocol. Acting quickly limits the spread of potential malware and ensures that experts can investigate and mitigate the threat.
learning_objectives: Recognize early signs of a potential infection.
Know the critical steps to minimize damage and involve the experts.

scenarios.title: Suspicious USB Discovery
scenarios.description: You find an unmarked USB drive in a common area of the office or parking lot.
tasks: Examine the situation to decide if you should use the drive.
Follow the training on handling unknown external devices.
Determine the proper reporting procedure.
scenarios.solution: Do not plug the USB drive into any device and immediately report its discovery to IT so it can be safely handled and analyzed. This procedure minimizes the risk of inadvertently introducing malware into your system.
learning_objectives: Understand the risks of using unknown external devices.
Learn the proper procedures for handling and reporting potential security threats.

scenarios.title: Social Media Confidentiality
scenarios.description: While posting on social media, you accidentally share a screenshot or details that include sensitive company information.
tasks: Review your social media post for any sensitive data before publishing.
Decide if the post needs to be edited or removed.
Follow the reporting procedure for accidental disclosures.
scenarios.solution: Immediately remove or edit the post to eliminate any sensitive information, and notify your supervisor and IT/security team about the incident. This action helps limit the spread of confidential data and reinforces the importance of vigilance when sharing online.
learning_objectives: Recognize the importance of safeguarding confidential information online.
Learn the steps to mitigate accidental disclosures on public platforms.

scenarios.title: Home Network Security for Remote Work
scenarios.description: Working from home, you discover that your Wi-Fi network is set to an outdated security protocol and uses a default router password.
tasks: Review your home network settings.
Follow the guidelines for updating Wi-Fi security.
Decide whether to use the company VPN for sensitive work.
scenarios.solution: Access your router settings, update the Wi-Fi encryption (preferably to WPA3), change the default router password to a strong, unique one, and use the company’s VPN when accessing sensitive data. This ensures your home network meets the security standards required for remote work.
learning_objectives: Understand basic home network security measures.
Learn how to protect company data while working remotely.

scenarios.title: Unattended Workstation Alert
scenarios.description: You step away from your desk for a break or meeting and forget to lock your computer.
tasks: Check whether you have locked your workstation before leaving.
Follow the guidelines for securing an unattended device.
Decide on actions if you return to an unlocked workstation.
scenarios.solution: Always lock your workstation before leaving your desk, and if you notice it unlocked upon your return, check for any unauthorized activity and report if necessary. This proactive measure helps prevent unauthorized access to your computer.
learning_objectives: Understand the importance of locking your device to prevent unauthorized access.
Reinforce best practices for securing unattended devices.

scenarios.title: Accidental Email Attachment Sharing
scenarios.description: You accidentally attach the wrong document to an email, sending sensitive company information to an unintended recipient.
tasks: Review the email and its attachments before sending.
Decide what to do immediately after realizing the error.
Follow the procedure for reporting such mistakes.
scenarios.solution: Contact the unintended recipient to request deletion of the email and attachment, and promptly notify IT/security to initiate the proper incident response. This ensures that the sensitive data is not further disseminated and that corrective actions are documented.
learning_objectives: Learn the importance of double-checking recipients and attachments before sending.
Understand the steps to mitigate accidental data disclosure.

scenarios.title: Lost Mobile Device
scenarios.description: While commuting, you realize that your company-issued smartphone is missing.
tasks: Assess the situation to determine if the device can be located.
Decide on the immediate actions to secure the device data.
Follow the company’s protocol for reporting lost devices.
scenarios.solution: Use available tracking tools to locate the device, immediately report the loss to IT to initiate remote lock/wipe procedures, and change passwords for any sensitive accounts accessed via the device. Acting swiftly helps prevent unauthorized access and minimizes potential data breaches.
learning_objectives: Understand the protocol for reporting lost or stolen devices.
Recognize the importance of prompt action to protect sensitive information.

scenarios.title: Suspicious Phone Call (Vishing)
scenarios.description: You receive a phone call from someone claiming to be from IT support who asks for your login credentials to 'resolve an urgent issue.'
tasks: Evaluate the authenticity of the call.
Decide whether to share any sensitive information over the phone.
Follow the established procedure for verifying such calls.
scenarios.solution: Do not provide any personal or login information; instead, independently verify the caller’s identity by contacting IT directly using a known, trusted number. This helps prevent social engineering attacks and ensures your credentials remain secure.
learning_objectives: Recognize phone-based social engineering tactics (vishing).
Learn how to verify and appropriately respond to suspicious calls.

scenarios.title: Fake IT Support Email
scenarios.description: An email appears to come from your IT department urging you to click a link to update your security software.
tasks: Examine the email carefully before interacting with it.
Decide if the email matches the company’s communication style.
Follow the procedure for verifying suspicious emails.
scenarios.solution: Do not click on any links or provide any information until you confirm the email’s legitimacy; forward the email to the official IT support address for verification. This ensures you do not fall victim to phishing scams and that the incident is documented for further review.
learning_objectives: Learn to distinguish between genuine and fraudulent IT communications.
Practice safe handling of unexpected security-related emails.

scenarios.title: Outdated Software Notification
scenarios.description: A pop-up appears on your computer prompting an 'urgent' software update that you don’t recall scheduling.
tasks: Review the pop-up to assess its authenticity.
Decide whether the update request is legitimate.
Follow the company procedure for software updates.
scenarios.solution: Avoid clicking the pop-up immediately; verify the update with IT and then use the official company channels to install any required updates. This approach prevents potential malware installations and ensures your system remains secure.
learning_objectives: Understand that unexpected update prompts might be malicious.
Learn to verify updates through trusted sources before proceeding.

scenarios.title: Risks of Public Wi-Fi
scenarios.description: While working remotely from a coffee shop or airport, you notice that the public Wi-Fi network is unsecured.
tasks: Review the security of the public Wi-Fi network before accessing sensitive data.
Decide whether to use the network for work-related tasks.
Follow guidelines for connecting securely in public spaces.
scenarios.solution: Avoid accessing sensitive company information on an unsecured network; instead, connect through a trusted VPN to ensure data security. This not only protects your information but also aligns with best practices for remote work security.
learning_objectives: Recognize the risks associated with public Wi-Fi networks.
Learn the importance of using secure connections and VPNs for remote work.

scenarios.title: Accidental Data Disclosure on Social Media
scenarios.description: You post a photo or status update that inadvertently reveals sensitive company information (such as a screenshot with confidential details).
tasks: Review the content of your post for accidental disclosures.
Decide whether the post should be edited or removed.
Follow the procedure for reporting accidental data exposure.
scenarios.solution: Immediately remove or edit the post to eliminate sensitive data, and report the incident to your supervisor and IT/security team. This prompt action minimizes exposure and reinforces the need for careful review before sharing information online.
learning_objectives: Understand the importance of reviewing content before sharing it on social platforms.
Learn how to quickly mitigate accidental data disclosures online.

scenarios.title: Suspicious Software Installation
scenarios.description: You notice a new program on your computer that you don’t remember installing—possibly bundled with another download.
tasks: Review the list of installed programs for unfamiliar software.
Decide whether the software should be executed.

scenarios.solution: Do not run or interact with the unfamiliar software and report the anomaly to IT for further investigation. This response helps prevent potential security breaches and ensures that any malicious software is promptly addressed.
learning_objectives: Recognize the risks of unauthorized software installations.
Understand the steps to take if unexpected software appears on your device.

scenarios.title: Unexpected Printer Behavior

Decide whether this behavior aligns with normal printer operations.

scenarios.title: Shoulder Surfing Risk

Decide if you need to shield your screen.
Follow the guidelines for maintaining privacy in public spaces.
scenarios.solution: Shield your screen by adjusting your seating or using a privacy filter, ask the person to give you space if necessary, and report any persistent behavior to your supervisor. These actions help protect your data from prying eyes and reinforce a culture of security awareness.
learning_objectives: Understand the risk of shoulder surfing.
Learn techniques to protect your screen and maintain privacy.

scenarios.title: Unattended Sensitive Documents

tasks: Review the area for unattended sensitive documents.
Decide if the documents are secured according to company guidelines.
Follow the procedure for handling confidential physical documents.

learning_objectives: Recognize the importance of handling sensitive physical documents securely.
Understand the need for proper disposal and storage procedures.

scenarios.title: Suspicious QR Code
scenarios.description: A promotional poster with a QR code appears around the office, promising rewards but potentially linking to a malicious site.
tasks: Review the QR code and its source before scanning.
Decide whether to scan the QR code based on its legitimacy.

scenarios.solution: Do not scan the QR code until its legitimacy is confirmed by IT; check with a colleague or supervisor to see if the campaign is official. Verifying the QR code helps protect against potential malware and phishing attacks.

scenarios.title: Public Conversation Exposure

scenarios.title: Unverified Social Media Connection

scenarios.title: Public Computer Usage

Follow the guidelines for safe public computer usage.

learning_objectives: Understand the risks of accessing sensitive information on public devices.
Learn the importance of proper sign-out procedures to prevent unauthorized access.

scenarios.title: Unauthorized App on Mobile Device

learning_objectives: Recognize the potential dangers of unauthorized apps.

scenarios.title: Improper Document Disposal

Learn how to prevent data leakage through improper document disposal.

scenarios.title: Personal USB Usage

Understand the importance of following secure data transfer protocols.

scenarios.title: Malicious Pop-up Advertisement

tasks: Review the pop-up ad without interacting with it.
Decide whether to click on the ad or ignore it.
Follow the guidelines for reporting suspicious online content.
scenarios.solution: Close the pop-up immediately without clicking any links and report the occurrence to IT if similar ads reappear. This helps protect your system from potential phishing attempts or malware infections.

Learn safe browsing practices to avoid interacting with harmful content.

scenarios.title: Misdirected Sensitive Email

tasks: Review the email carefully to determine if it was misdirected.
Decide whether to interact with the email content.
Follow the procedure for handling misdirected emails.
scenarios.solution: Do not forward or engage with the email; notify the sender or IT immediately about the misdirected sensitive information. This prevents the accidental spread of confidential data and ensures proper handling according to company protocols.
learning_objectives: Understand the importance of handling misdirected information securely.
Learn proper reporting procedures for receiving sensitive data in error.

scenarios.title: Anomalous Copier Activity

tasks: Monitor the copier for any unusual activity.
Decide if the behavior deviates from normal usage.

Understand the importance of reporting anomalies promptly.

scenarios.title: Unsolicited IT Survey Request

tasks: Review the survey request for potential red flags.

scenarios.title: Questionable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) Prompt

Learn to verify authentication prompts before proceeding.

scenarios.title: Altered Email Signature

tasks: Review the email signature for discrepancies.
Decide if the changes appear legitimate.

learning_objectives: Recognize signs of a potentially compromised email account.
Understand the importance of verifying unexpected changes in email communications.

scenarios.title: Fake System Maintenance Notification

Understand the importance of verifying unexpected maintenance communications.

scenarios.title: Overexposed Social Media Post

Learn how to quickly mitigate accidental data exposure.

Learn how to confirm the legitimacy of such communications.
